title: Did Ted Bishop's Punishment Fit His Crime?

brightcove_ramp_keywords: Ian Poulter,Nick Faldo,Tom Watson,Ryder Cup,Sports Illustrated,Sigmund Freud,GOLF Magazine,Mike Walker
headline: Tour Confidential: Did Ted Bishop's Punishment Fit His Crime?
description: While there's little debate that Ted Bishop needed to go as President of the PGA of America, our panel differs on whether there were other reasons for his firing.
short_headline: Tour Confidential: Did Ted Bishop's Punishment Fit His Crime?
page_title: Tour Confidential PGA President Ted Bishop Fired
slug: Tour Confidential: Did Ted Bishop's Punishment Fit His Crime?
body: While there's little disagreement that Ted Bishop needed to go as President of the PGA of America in the wake of his calling Ian Poulter a "lil girl" on Twitter, our panel debates whether there were other reasons for his firing, as well as the appropriateness of the additional penal steps the PGA took to admonish — and distance itself from — the organization's former chief.
